EmailTemplate.name: NorthAm_Event_ Inaugural Geode Summit_Palo Alto_Q116.Post event email - 6-1-16
EmailTemplate.subject: Experience Apache Geode Summit Again—The Replays are Posted!
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear {{lead.First Name:default=edit me}},
What an amazing time we had at Apache Geode Summit <[[http://geodesummit.com/]]> in March!
We’ve been enjoying reliving the memories with pictures and videos posted by attendees <[[https://storify.com/gregchase/geodesummit-a-twitter-proceedings]]>.
Many of you have asked where you could find the slides or replays from the sessions. We have posted these on the Apache Geode Summit schedule <[[https://2016.event.geodesummit.com/schedule]]>. If you were attending the sessions in the main stage, you may also be interested in viewing the future feature discussions <[[https://2016.event.geodesummit.com/schedule]]> between the contributors.
We also invite you to enjoy our blog of Key Takeaways from Apache Geode Summit <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/?p=36055]]>.
To stay connected with the Apache Geode community, please subscribe to the Apache Geode user mail list by sending an email to user-subscribe@geode.incubator.apache.org <[[mailto:user-subscribe@geode.incubator.apache.org]]>. You can also check out the Apache Geode community site <[[http://geode.incubator.apache.org/]]> for access to development information and open source releases.
To learn more about the commercial version, Pivotal GemFire, check out the product site <[[http://pivotal.io/big-data/pivotal-gemfire]]> for access to documentation and trial downloads.
Best regards,
The Apache Geode Community Team
